question.title: Gradle jibBuildTar error: java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException: component\docker-images\build\jib-image.tar
question.body:
I am working on a project that builds Java submodules and creates docker containers using Jib for some of the submodules.

The build.gradle script works perfectly on Mac. But it fails on Windows.

Here is the stacktrace snippet:

Caused by: java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException: component\docker-images\build\jib-image.tar at org.gradle.internal.classpath.declarations.NioFileInterceptors.intercept_newInputStream(NioFileInterceptors.java:161) at com.google.cloud.tools.jib.tar.TarExtractor.extract(TarExtractor.java:72)

The strange thing is I can see the file jib-image.tar under [project-root]/component/docker-images/build in the file system.

The gradle command I used that caused the above error is:

./gradlew :component:user-cart-ai:jibBuildTar

I googled around and found some posts about Windows file permissions are set differently than Mac. So I asked our system admin to enable full control access for every user on all files under [project-root]/component/docker-images/build. But that didn't work.

What did I miss?
